consonants.name: giyeok

mnemonic.text: Looks like a gun → G sound

consonants.articulatory: Back of tongue touches soft palate

consonants.name: nieun

mnemonic.text: Shape of nose bridge → N sound

consonants.articulatory: Tongue tip touches behind upper teeth

consonants.name: digeut

mnemonic.text: D shape like a door frame → D sound

consonants.articulatory: Tongue tip touches upper gum ridge

consonants.name: rieul

mnemonic.text: Looks like a ladder → R/L sound

consonants.articulatory: Tongue flaps against upper gum ridge

mnemonic.text: Square like a closed mouth → M sound
Looks like a bed frame → B sound

consonants.name: siot

mnemonic.text: Looks like a sail → S sound

consonants.articulatory: Air passes through narrow gap at upper teeth

consonants.name: ieung
consonants.articulatory: Silent as initial; 'ng' as final consonant

consonants.name: jieut

mnemonic.text: Like a jug handle → J sound

consonants.articulatory: Tongue touches behind upper teeth with friction

consonants.name: chieut
consonants.articulatory: Like ㅈ but with strong burst of air

consonants.name: kieuk
consonants.articulatory: Like ㄱ but with strong burst of air

consonants.name: tieut
consonants.articulatory: Like ㄷ but with strong burst of air

consonants.name: pieup
consonants.articulatory: Like ㅂ but with strong burst of air

mnemonic.text: Person wearing a hat → H sound

consonants.name: ssang-giyeok
consonants.articulatory: Like ㄱ but with tense throat, no air

consonants.name: ssang-digeut
consonants.articulatory: Like ㄷ but with tense throat, no air

consonants.name: ssang-bieup
consonants.articulatory: Like ㅂ but with tense throat, no air

consonants.name: ssang-siot
consonants.articulatory: Like ㅅ but sharper and tenser

consonants.name: ssang-jieut
consonants.articulatory: Like ㅈ but with tense throat, no air

mnemonic.text: Line on top like sunrise = Oh!
Flat line = tired face, no energy → Eu
Tall vertical line like a tree = Ee!

vertical.label: Type B
vertical.description: Vowel goes to the RIGHT of consonant

whisperTest.title: The Whisper Test
whisperTest.description: Try whispering the sound. If it feels natural, it's aspirated! Plain consonants feel awkward when whispered.
whisperTest.example: Whisper ㅌ (t) - feels natural. Whisper ㄷ (d) - feels weird!

handPosition.title: Hand Position Trick
handPosition.description: Stretch your right hand out = ㅏ (ah!). Stretch your left hand out = ㅓ (uh!)
handPosition.detail: The branch direction on ㅣ tells you: right branch (ㅏ) or left branch (ㅓ)

aspirationPattern.title: Aspiration Pattern
aspirationPattern.description: Basic consonant + one extra stroke = aspirated version (more air!)

doublePattern.title: Double (Tense) Consonants
doublePattern.description: Write the consonant twice = tense version (tight throat, no air!)

yPattern.title: Y-Sound Pattern
yPattern.description: Basic vowel + extra line = Y prefix added!

errorNormalization.title: Don't worry!
messages: 95% of Koreans can't tell ㅐ from ㅔ either!
Even native speakers mix up ㄲ and ㄱ sometimes!
Pronunciation improves naturally with listening. Keep going!
You're doing better than you think!
